stabilizer.translation[0].definitions[0]: a chemical that helps something such as a food to stay in the same state, for example to prevent it from separating into different liquids
stabilizer.translation[0].definitions[1]: a piece of equipment that helps make something such as a plane or ship steady
stabilizer.translation[0].definitions[2]: one of a pair of small wheels that are fastened to the back wheel of a childâ€™s bicycle to prevent it from falling over
stabilizer.translation[1].definitions[0]: one of the ways in which a government tries to prevent large movements in the level of employment, incomes, prices, and production, for example by controlling interest rates, income tax, and government spending
Taxes and public spending act as automatic stabilisers in modern economies.
